body_html:
Ah. That's right, tf.while_loop (used by dynamic_rnn) does not support second derivatives; and there are no plans for support in the near or mid-term future. I'm afraid if you want this, you'll have to use a static RNN.
…
On Wed, Apr 5, 2017 at 5:18 PM, Ankesh Anand ***@***.***> wrote: The relevant portion is this: gradients = tf.gradients(discriminator(x_dash, reuse=True)[0], [x_dash])[0] The discriminator here is a simple LSTM implemented using tf.nn.dynamic_rnn. The error I get is: TypeError: Second-order gradient for while loops not supported. I am trying to implement the gradient penalty term from this paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.00028 (Improved training of WassGANs) — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#5985 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtimxZMeUPnCyEaRmHnKQAQOh6Q0z5Hks5rtC9SgaJpZM4LAZNz> .
body_text:
Ah.

That's right, tf.while_loop (used by dynamic_rnn) does not support second
derivatives; and there are no plans for support in the near or mid-term
future.  I'm afraid if you want this, you'll have to use a static RNN.
…
On Wed, Apr 5, 2017 at 5:18 PM, Ankesh Anand ***@***.***> wrote:
 The relevant portion is this:
 gradients = tf.gradients(discriminator(x_dash, reuse=True)[0],
 [x_dash])[0]

 The discriminator here is a simple LSTM implemented using
 tf.nn.dynamic_rnn.

 The error I get is: TypeError: Second-order gradient for while loops not
 supported.

 I am trying to implement the gradient penalty term from this paper:
 https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.00028 (Improved training of WassGANs)

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

 .
body:
Ah.

That's right, tf.while_loop (used by dynamic_rnn) does not support second
derivatives; and there are no plans for support in the near or mid-term
future.  I'm afraid if you want this, you'll have to use a static RNN.

On Wed, Apr 5, 2017 at 5:18 PM, Ankesh Anand <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> The relevant portion is this:
> gradients = tf.gradients(discriminator(x_dash, reuse=True)[0],
> [x_dash])[0]
>
> The discriminator here is a simple LSTM implemented using
> tf.nn.dynamic_rnn.
>
> The error I get is: TypeError: Second-order gradient for while loops not
> supported.
>
> I am trying to implement the gradient penalty term from this paper:
> https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.00028 (Improved training of WassGANs)
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/5985#issuecomment-292033647>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtimxZMeUPnCyEaRmHnKQAQOh6Q0z5Hks5rtC9SgaJpZM4LAZNz>
> .
>
